Cranberry Relish

Jump to Recipe

Welcome to the delightful world of homemade cranberry relish! This vibrant and tangy condiment is the perfect accompaniment to your holiday meals, offering a refreshing contrast to savory dishes. Made with fresh cranberries, a hint of zesty orange, and sweet crushed pineapple, this cranberry relish recipe is not only simple to prepare but also packed with flavor. Whether you're serving it alongside turkey, ham, or simply enjoying it on a cracker, this relish is sure to impress your family and friends. Plus, with the option to add chopped walnuts, you can introduce an extra layer of texture and richness. Let’s dive into the ingredients and steps needed to create this delicious cranberry relish that will elevate any festive gathering!

Ingredients

fresh cranberries

Look for bright, plump cranberries without any blemishes. If fresh cranberries are unavailable, you can use frozen cranberries; just do not thaw them beforehand. Make sure to rinse them well before use.

sugar

Granulated sugar is the most common choice, but you can substitute with brown sugar for a deeper flavor or honey/maple syrup for a natural sweetness. Just adjust the quantity according to taste.

orange, zested and juiced

Use a microplane for zesting to get fine shavings of the orange peel without the bitter white pith. If you're out of oranges, lemon juice and zest can work as a substitute, though the flavor will be slightly different.

pineapple, crushed, drained

Fresh pineapple can be used instead of canned for a brighter flavor, but make sure to crush it finely. If unavailable, canned peaches or pears might be a good alternative, though the flavor profile will change.

walnuts, chopped (optional)

Toasting the walnuts before adding them can enhance their flavor and texture. If you have nut allergies, seeds like sunflower or pumpkin can be a great substitute for crunch.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Prepare the Cranberries

    Begin by rinsing the fresh cranberries under cold running water. This step is crucial to remove any dirt or impurities. As you rinse them, look for and remove any stems or bad berries that may have spoiled.

  • Step 2: Combine Ingredients

    In a mixing bowl, combine the rinsed fresh cranberries, 3/4 cup of sugar, the zest and juice from 1 orange, and 1 cup of drained crushed pineapple. The sugar helps to balance the tartness of the cranberries and enhances the overall flavor.

  • Step 3: Add Optional Ingredients

    If you like a bit of crunch and additional flavor, add 1/2 cup of chopped walnuts. This is optional, but walnuts add a lovely texture to the relish.

  • Step 4: Mix Well

    Using a spatula or spoon, gently mix all the ingredients together until they are well combined. Ensure that the sugar is evenly distributed and the cranberries are coated with the orange juice and zest.

  • Step 5: Let it Sit

    Allow the relish to sit for about 10 minutes before serving. This resting period is important as it allows the flavors to meld together, creating a more harmonious taste.

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I prepare fresh cranberries for cooking?

Rinse fresh cranberries under cold water, removing any stems or bad berries. Good cranberries will be firm and bright in color.

What can I use instead of fresh cranberries?

You can use frozen cranberries if fresh ones aren't available. Just make sure to thaw them first and drain any excess liquid.

How do I zest an orange?

To zest an orange, use a microplane or a fine grater to gently rub the outer skin of the orange, avoiding the bitter white pith underneath.

How do I know if my orange is juicy?

Choose oranges that feel heavy for their size and have a slightly soft texture when squeezed. These are usually juicier.

Can I make cranberry relish ahead of time?

Yes! You can make cranberry relish a day in advance. Just store it in an airtight container in the refrigerator to allow the flavors to develop.

What if I don't like walnuts?

You can leave out the walnuts or substitute them with another nut like pecans, or add seeds like pumpkin seeds for crunch.

How long can I store cranberry relish?

Cranberry relish can be stored in the refrigerator for up to two weeks. Just make sure it's in a sealed container.

What are some ways to serve cranberry relish?

Cranberry relish pairs well with turkey, ham, or can be used as a topping for cream cheese on crackers. Get creative!

Is it safe to eat raw cranberries?

Yes, raw cranberries are safe to eat! However, they are quite tart, so they are often sweetened in recipes.

How can I enhance the flavor of my cranberry relish?

Consider adding a pinch of cinnamon or nutmeg for warmth, or a splash of vanilla extract for depth.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

This Cranberry Relish is naturally gluten-free and can easily be made vegan by substituting the sugar with a plant-based sweetener like agave syrup or coconut sugar. For nut allergies, simply omit the walnuts or replace them with sunflower seeds for added crunch. You can also adjust the sweetness by reducing the sugar according to personal preference.

Pairings

Cranberry Relish pairs wonderfully with roasted turkey, ham, or chicken, adding a burst of tartness and sweetness that complements the savory flavors. For a vegetarian option, serve it alongside a nut loaf or stuffing. Beverage pairings include a crisp white wine like Sauvignon Blanc or a light-bodied red like Pinot Noir. For non-alcoholic options, consider sparkling apple cider or a refreshing ginger ale.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the Cranberry Relish chilled or at room temperature in a decorative bowl, garnished with a few whole cranberries or a sprig of mint for visual appeal. It can be served as a condiment next to the main dish or as part of a festive charcuterie board. For an elegant touch, consider placing it in small individual serving cups alongside cheese and crackers as an appetizer.

Cranberry Relish

10 min
$5
120 kcal
Difficulty: 10%
Servings: 8

Allergens:

Nuts

Dietary Tags:

VegetarianGluten-Free

Cuisine:

American

Course:

Side DishCondiment

Tags:

EasyQuickHolidayCondiment

Description

A fresh, tangy, and sweet cranberry relish that perfectly complements holiday meals and everyday dishes alike.

Ingredients

  • fresh cranberries: 12 oz
  • sugar: 3/4 cup
  • orange, zested and juiced: 1
  • pineapple, crushed, drained: 1 cup
  • walnuts, chopped (optional): 1/2 cup

Date Created:

11/22/2024
